article.headline: William &amp, Mary 66, Towson 49
article.story: TOWSON, Md. -- Quinn McDowell scored 26 points as William & Mary handed Towson its 36th consecutive loss 66-49 Wednesday night in Colonial Athletic Association action. Towson lost its final 19 games last year and now its first 17 this season for the longest losing skid in Division I history. New Jersey Institute of Technology had a 51-game losing streak spanning NJIT's transition from Division II to Division I. The Tigers (0-17, 0-5) trailed 28-24 at halftime. But in the second half, McDowell scored 17 of his 26 points as the Tribe (4-14, 2-3) outscored Towson 38-25. Julian Boatner came off the Tribe bench to score 12 points on four 3-pointers. Marcus Damas led Towson with 14 points. Robert Nwankwo added 11 and Deon Jones 10. The Tribe hit 24 of 48 field goals, including 7 of 21 3-pointers. Towson was just 20 of 52,including 4 for 15 on treys.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
